newsitem.title: UK: Levi Strauss launches European ads for Dockers.
newsitem.headline: Levi Strauss launches European ads for Dockers.

text.p: Levi Strauss & Co's Dockers Europe is launching its first pan-European advertising campaign with a theme of "not quite all-American," advertising agency Bartle Bogle Hegarty (BBH) said on Friday.

The multi-media campaign by BBH features two separate ads -- one for television and another for cinema -- as well as press, poster and radio ads. It is BBH's first campaign for Dockers, Levi's range of casual clothes aimed at 25- to 35-year-old men, since winning the account last July.
BBH said the campaign is designed to build the Dockers brand profile and market share in a marketplace that has no current leader.

"In the U.S. two out of every three men owns a pair of Dockers pants," Carl van Buskirk, president of Levi Strauss & Co, Europe, said in a statement. "After this year, I see Europe moving in the same direction."
BBH declined to disclose the advertising budget for the campaign.
